params.data: The resulting data from the call. This is error data when the call was not a success. Otherwise,                this is malformed data when the call was a success.
params.success: If the call to the token was a success.

params.minReturnShares: The maximum shares of slippage that the user will accept on new position.
params.minReturnUnderlying: The minimum underlying value when withdrawing from old position.
params.shares: The shares of tokens to migrate.
params.startingYieldToken: The yield token from which the user wants to withdraw.
params.targetYieldToken: The yield token that the user wishes to create a new position in.

returns._0: The underlying Value of the new position.
If the migration will be succesful.
returns._1: The specific reason the migration will fail.
returns._2: This is the amount a user is exceeding the vault by, or how much debt value the user must cover.
returns._3: Minimum shares for the migrate function.
returns._4: Minimum underlying for the migrate function.

ERC20CallFailed(address,bool,bytes).notice: An error used to indicate that a call to an ERC20 contract failed.

IllegalArgument().notice: An error used to indicate that an action could not be completed because of an illegal argument was passed         to the function.

IllegalArgument(string).notice: An error used to indicate that an argument passed to a function is illegal or         inappropriate.

IllegalState(string).notice: An error used to indicate that a function has encountered an unrecoverable state.

previewMigration(address,address,address.notice: Determines if a migration will be succesful before allowing a user to migrate.
